title: Famous People in Secret Files
summary: The US government released some secret files about a man named Jeffrey Epstein. These files have pictures and videos of famous people like former President Bill Clinton and others. Being in the files does not mean these people did anything wrong. Many have said they did not know about Epstein's bad actions. The files show old photos of Clinton, and his spokesperson says they are from long ago and not important. The files also mention another famous person, but everyone should remember that just being named does not prove anything. The government was supposed to release all the files by a deadline, but some people are upset because not everything was shared and parts are hidden.

covered up so you cannot see it

background_read: Jeffrey Epstein was a wealthy man who was accused of doing bad things to young people. The government is sharing files about him to help people understand what happened. Famous people are sometimes involved in news stories, but it is important to know that being named does not always mean they did anything wrong. This helps us learn about how the government works and why secrets are sometimes kept.
Article_Structure: WHO: The US government and famous people like Bill Clinton
WHAT: Released secret files about Jeffrey Epstein with pictures and videos
WHY: To share information, but some parts are hidden and people are upset

perspectives.description: The government is trying to follow the law by releasing files, but it is hard to do it all on time.
Famous people say they did nothing wrong and the files are old and not important.
